Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical Ablation During Mitral Valve Surgery for Persistent Atrial Fibrillation

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 260 patients with persistent AF were randomised

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either MVS with surgical ablation or MVS alone

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effect of lesion set on long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation (AF)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was freedom from AF, atrial flutter (AFL), or atrial tachycardia (AT) over 12 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed

Number_Randomised.evidence: 260 patients with persistent AF were randomised

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 228 patients (88%) submitted 7949 TTM recordings

Result_Outcome.evidence: Freedom from AF/AFL/AT was higher in the ablation group compared to MVS alone (63% vs 29%; P < .001)
